intro: Wimmeria pallida, commonly known as the pale wimmeria, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually small and pale in color, often appearing in clusters. Wimmeria pallida is known for its resilience in arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
